summary: (9/12/18) The Pokémon marathon on Twitch is now LIVE! The next 10 episodes that is going to be streamed (from Season 3 The Johto...
body:
(9/12/18) The Pokémon marathon on Twitch is now LIVE!

The next 10 episodes that is going to be streamed (from Season 3 The Johto Journeys) will feature Gligarman, Ash catching his Cyndaquil, the gang arriving at Azalea Town, a Wobbufett trade that changed Team Rocket’s lives forever and much much more!

The episode set will rerun in multiple times today just so you won’t miss the stream depending on your schedule.

Watching with Twitch chat could be the best (or worst) experience you’ll ever have! But if you want a more comfy chat experience, feel free to talk/chat about the marathon in my Pokémon Discord server PokéTōku —> Invite link here :)

summary: I haven’t done much here but like and reblog a couple random posts here and there. I’m still drawing and writing and making...
caption:
I haven’t done much here but like and reblog a couple random posts here and there.

I’m still drawing and writing and making stuff.  Just very slowly.

Started this sketch around the time Moltres first came out in raids in Pokemon Go.  I was basically in a garbage mood because depression, something about not being able to catch one (at the time) just was the catalyst that exacerbated said depression.  I figured if I couldn’t catch one, then I would draw one and it’d be better than what I could catch.

Granted like a week later a got one and this sketch kinda sat around to rot for a bit.

Skip ahead to Moltres Day, I was already in an awful depressive slump, and that didn’t get better with the day.  Something about this dumb spicy chicken…I always seem to be in the middle of a depressive episode with this sucker is out in raids.  Granted I’m still working through this current depressive episode but…eh…¯\_(ツ)_/¯

So I decided to pick this sketch back up but color it as a shiny variant.  Let’s see how that goes since I haven’t done traditional realism in forever and a day.

But I still have a score to settle with this bird.  Ultra Unlock raids, here I come!

blog.name: pokemoncaretaking
blog.title: Pokemon Caretaking and Biology
blog.description: Pokemon headcanons and RP, focusing on Pokemon biology and caretaking. I'm a Pokemon breeder from Johto, now living in Hoenn!

summary: Gengar, chandelure, honedge, and for a friend who hasn't got tumblr, umbreon?
question: Gengar, chandelure, honedge, and for a friend who hasn't got tumblr, umbreon?
answer:
Ooh lots of good Pokemon here!

Let’s start with Gengar. The archetypal Ghost-type, Gengar can be hard to raise for a beginner. They’re mischievous and potentially dangerous, but can be very rewarding to keep once they’ve been trained. I would recommend training them from a Ghastly. They need clear boundaries, and their penchant for walking through walls can prove problematic. I would recommend keeping areas you want to keep your Gengar out of well-lit, clean, and potentially warded with Cleanse Tags, which should be rotated about every two weeks (something that holds true for most Ghost-type Pokemon). Warnings aside, some Gengar are friendly and even affectionate, and they’re definitely worth the effort if you’re a competitive battler.

Chandelure offers some unique challenges to someone who’s only worked with more traditional Ghost-types. They have a great deal of control over their flames, but I would still recommend fire-proofing your home. Similar to the Charmander line, their open flames make them nervous around water type pokemon and open water, so take that into consideration when adding one to your team. They’re also less mischievous than other Ghost Pokemon.

Honedge get a lot of flack because of the myth that touching their handles lets them steal souls. While they do siphon energy from those that touch them, they don’t have a high enough rate of absorption to cause lasting harm. They’re more a Steel-type than a Ghost-type, and have a lot of the same needs as most Steel-types (polishing, nick managing), but they feed on energy instead of metallic compounds.

Umbreon is a stand out among Dark-types because of how friendly they are to their trainers and people in general.They’re quite affectionate and easy to care for, as long as you give them time and enrichment. They do need a higher-protein diet than an Eevee, and need a different style of brush, but overall I follow similar guidelines. They can also excrete poisonous sweat when threatened, so keep antidotes on hand. Because of this I would hesitate to recommend Umbreon to a family with young children.

summary: Tumblr’s response to Kurin: WTF!? Who said pikachu needed a girlfriend!? Why did they have to give her a design like that too??...
body:
Tumblr’s response to Kurin: WTF!? Who said pikachu needed a girlfriend!? Why did they have to give her a design like that too?? This is an OUTRAGE! The anime is ruined now!!!

Me: aww, she has a cute little puff on her head like in the upcoming games and I love female pikachu’s little heart shaped tails. I hope they make her a nice little pikachu. :)

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Happichic, Chanbusken and Blissiken Happiny and Torchic fusion, Chansey and Combusken fusion and Blissey and Blaziken fusion All...
caption:
Happichic, Chanbusken and Blissiken

Happiny and Torchic fusion, Chansey and Combusken fusion and Blissey and Blaziken fusion

All are Fire/Normal Type

Ability: Blaze

Hidden Ability: Flame Body

Stats

Happichic: HP - 80, Atk - 70, Def - 15, SpA - 70, SpD - 15, Spe - 50

Chanbusken: HP - 140, Atk - 80, Def - 45, SpA - 80, SpD - 45, Spe - 60

Blissiken: HP - 220, Atk - 130, Def - 70, SpA - 130, SpD - 70, Spe - 90

Happichic - The Young Chick Pokemon

Chanbusken - The Caring Chicken Pokemon

Blissiken - The Protective Chicken Pokemon

Happichic’s body is very warm and fluffy.  It finds small eggs and keeps them in its fluff until they hatch.  However, it doesn’t really care about what hatches and will abandon the baby pokemon.

Chanbusken is very caring and will want to take care of anything egg shaped.  Many say that it is shaped like a friend.

Blissiken is known as the egg sitter of the pokemon world as it will look after other pokemon’s eggs and protect them with its life. It’s body temperature can be altered to suit what temperature the egg needs to be.  

Request for @allhailthetumbledlords. I hope you like it. I’m sorry if you requested this one ages ago but today was the first time I’ve ever seen it.  I don’t know what happened to it.

Hidden Ability: Flame Body

Stats

Happichic: HP - 80, Atk - 70, Def - 15, SpA - 70, SpD - 15, Spe - 50

Chanbusken: HP - 140, Atk - 80, Def - 45, SpA - 80, SpD - 45, Spe - 60

Blissiken: HP - 220, Atk - 130, Def - 70, SpA - 130, SpD - 70, Spe - 90

Happichic - The Young Chick Pokemon

Chanbusken - The Caring Chicken Pokemon

Blissiken - The Protective Chicken Pokemon

Happichic’s body is very warm and fluffy.  It finds small eggs and keeps them in its fluff until they hatch.  However, it doesn’t really care about what hatches and will abandon the baby pokemon.

Chanbusken is very caring and will want to take care of anything egg shaped.  Many say that it is shaped like a friend.

Blissiken is known as the egg sitter of the pokemon world as it will look after other pokemon’s eggs and protect them with its life. It’s body temperature can be altered to suit what temperature the egg needs to be.  

Request for @allhailthetumbledlords. I hope you like it. I’m sorry if you requested this one ages ago but today was the first time I’ve ever seen it.  I don’t know what happened to it.
trail.content:
Happichic, Chanbusken and Blissiken

Happiny and Torchic fusion, Chansey and Combusken fusion and Blissey and Blaziken fusion

All are Fire/Normal Type

Ability: Blaze

Hidden Ability: Flame Body

Stats

Happichic: HP - 80, Atk - 70, Def - 15, SpA - 70, SpD - 15, Spe - 50

Chanbusken: HP - 140, Atk - 80, Def - 45, SpA - 80, SpD - 45, Spe - 60

Blissiken: HP - 220, Atk - 130, Def - 70, SpA - 130, SpD - 70, Spe - 90

Chanbusken is very caring and will want to take care of anything egg shaped.  Many say that it is shaped like a friend.

Blissiken is known as the egg sitter of the pokemon world as it will look after other pokemon’s eggs and protect them with its life. It’s body temperature can be altered to suit what temperature the egg needs to be.  

Request for @allhailthetumbledlords. I hope you like it. I’m sorry if you requested this one ages ago but today was the first time I’ve ever seen it.  I don’t know what happened to it.

summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1376: Engineer’s Adjustments (Unleashed)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1376: Engineer’s Adjustments (Unleashed)
body: Engineer’s Adjustments was yet another drawing Supporter in this set, but this time it came with more power. You needed to discard an Energy card from your hand, but you got 4 cards in return. Decks with low Energy counts, of course, were not using this, but there were a few options out there to use this to help with Energy acceleration from the discard pile. Typhlosion Prime and Magnezone were two very notable options for this. Sure, it was a bit limited to those sorts of decks, and the heavy drawing competition, especially with cards like N and Professor Juniper showing up later in HGSS-On, made it tough, but this was worth thinking about adding to decks where Energy being discarded was a good thing.
